climbs.name: Imperial Salute
climbs.fa: Matt Conroy, with Chris Pipas and Eddie Booph

content.description: Same start as "Hail Yes".  After climbing past the small tree in the cliff, traverse left to the left crack.  Climb nice crack to some fun finger locks.

climbs.name: Hail Yes
climbs.fa: Chris Pipas, with Matt Conroy and Eddie Booph

content.description: Really fun climb for the grade.  Climb the really nice hand crack in the center of the cliff.
content.location: Center crack of Hail Vader cliff.  Either scramble down the left side of the cliff or rappel down off a tree to access the bottom of the climb.

climbs.name: Hail No
climbs.fa: Eddie Booph, with Chris Pipas and Matt Conroy

content.description: Broken start leads to nice left facing crack.
content.location: Crack on the right side of Hail Vader.

content.description: Hail Vader is a new cliff at Rumney and it's location is best described as upper, upper, Darth Vader.  Several of us spent an entire day cleaning this new crag with hours of on and off hail storms, hence the name.  It has the same south facing orientation as Jimmy Cliff and Darth Vader Wall.  There are 3 trad routes on the cliff 5.2, 5.3, 5.4 all about 30 ft in length.  This would be a great cliff for beginner trad climbers if it wasn't sketchy to get to the base and right above a popular wall.  Gear placements are very easy.  The rock is super solid and the climbs are very fun for their grade.  There are no anchors at the top of these routes.
